channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: YouTube agrees to pay Trump $24 million to settle lawsuit over Jan. 6 suspension
item.description: YouTube is the latest social media company to pay Trump tens of millions of dollars to resolve lawsuits brought before he returned to power. The money will fund a new ballroom at the White House.
item.content:encoded:
YouTube is the latest social media company to pay Trump tens of millions of dollars to resolve lawsuits brought before he returned to power. The money will fund a new ballroom at the White House.

(Image credit: Josh Edelson)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: A year after Helene, a group of raft guides embarks on a river clean-up mission
item.description: A popular rafting river in the Appalachian mountains is still closed a year after Hurricane Helene, because there's just too much debris. Now, rafting guides have come together to help clean it up.
item.content:encoded:
A popular rafting river in the Appalachian mountains is still closed a year after Hurricane Helene, because there's just too much debris. Now, rafting guides have come together to help clean it up.

(Image credit: Rolando Arrieta)
item.dc:creator: Rolando Arrieta

item.title: Lesotho's Famo music: from shepherd songs to gang wars
item.description: In Lesotho, a style of traditional accordion music called Famo has become entangled with deadly gang rivalries. Once the soundtrack of shepherds and migrant workers, today it's linked to killings, government bans — and a fight over cultural identity.
item.content:encoded:
In Lesotho, a style of traditional accordion music called Famo has become entangled with deadly gang rivalries. Once the soundtrack of shepherds and migrant workers, today it's linked to killings, government bans — and a fight over cultural identity.

(Image credit: MARCO LONGARI)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: Comic Cristela Alonzo grew up in fear of border patrol. ICE has 'brought it all back'
item.description: For the first seven years of her life, Alonzo lived in an abandoned diner in a south Texas border town. Her new Netflix stand-up special is called Upper Classy.
item.content:encoded:
Upper Classy.'/>

For the first seven years of her life, Alonzo lived in an abandoned diner in a south Texas border town. Her new Netflix stand-up special is called Upper Classy.

(Image credit: Lauren Smith)
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: Compass-Anywhere real estate merger could squeeze small brokerages
item.description: The deal, announced earlier this week, would combine the two largest U.S. residential brokerages by sales volume.
item.content:encoded:
The deal, announced earlier this week, would combine the two largest U.S. residential brokerages by sales volume.

(Image credit: Charles Krupa)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Police say 'everyone has been accounted for' in Michigan church attack that killed 4
item.description: The suspect, Thomas Jacob Sanford, served in the Marines from 2004 to 2008, military officials confirmed to NPR. He was killed in a shootout with police.
item.content:encoded:
The suspect, Thomas Jacob Sanford, served in the Marines from 2004 to 2008, military officials confirmed to NPR. He was killed in a shootout with police.

(Image credit: Emily Elconin)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Lawsuits against Tylenol's maker get a boost after Trump's comments
item.description: A law firm appealing a stalled case against Tylenol's maker, Kenvue, says people are calling to join the suit, alleging the painkiller caused autism in children whose mothers took it during pregnancy.
item.content:encoded:
A law firm appealing a stalled case against Tylenol's maker, Kenvue, says people are calling to join the suit, alleging the painkiller caused autism in children whose mothers took it during pregnancy.

(Image credit: Francis Chung/Politico/Bloomberg)
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin

item.title: Trump announces an agreement with Israel to end war in Gaza
item.description: Ahead of the leaders' meeting on Monday, the White House released its peace plan to immediately end Israel's war in the territory, boost aid to Gaza and require Hamas to release Israeli hostages.
item.content:encoded:
Ahead of the leaders' meeting on Monday, the White House released its peace plan to immediately end Israel's war in the territory, boost aid to Gaza and require Hamas to release Israeli hostages.

(Image credit: Jim Lo Scalzo)
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: 3 things to know about Trump's plan to send troops to Portland and Memphis
item.description: President Trump ordered the deployment of troops to Portland and said he's authorized them to use "full force" to curb protests outside ICE facilities.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump ordered the deployment of troops to Portland and said he's authorized them to use "full force" to curb protests outside ICE facilities.

(Image credit: Mathieu Lewis-Rolland)
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: The latest on the Michigan church shooting. And, Trump's new plan to end war in Gaza
item.description: The FBI is searching for answers as to why a man drove his truck into a church yesterday and opened fire. And, Trump has a new proposed plan to end the war in Gaza.
item.content:encoded:
The FBI is searching for answers as to why a man drove his truck into a church yesterday and opened fire. And, Trump has a new proposed plan to end the war in Gaza.

(Image credit: Bill Pugliano)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton
